sentence.Network_en: She ran away with a man called McTavish last year.
sentence.Network_cn: 去年，她和一个叫麦克塔维什的男人私奔了。

sentence.Network_en: I have $100m hidden away where no one will ever find it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把1亿美元藏到了一个永远没人会找到的地方。

sentence.Network_en: He wiped away the blood with a paper napkin.

jx.jx_en_mean: said as an exhortation to overcome or be rid of something; let us be rid of

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  onweg, aweg 'on one's way' (see a-, way)

entry.def: If someone or something moves or is moved away from a place, they move or are moved so that they are no longer there. If you are away from a place, you are not in the place where people expect you to be.

example.ex: An injured policeman was led away by colleagues...
example.tran: 受伤的警察被同伴带走了。

example.ex: He walked away from his car...
example.tran: 他从自己的车边走开了。

entry.def: If you look or turn away from something, you move your head so that you are no longer looking at it.

example.ex: She quickly looked away and stared down at her hands...
example.tran: 她马上将目光移开，低头盯着自己的手。

example.ex: As he stands up, he turns his face away from her so that she won't see his tears.
example.tran: 站起身时，他将脸别过去，以免让她看到眼中的泪水。

entry.def: If you put or tidy something away, you put it where it should be. If you hide someone or something away, you put them in a place where nobody can see them or find them.

example.ex: I put my journal away and prepared for bed...
example.tran: 我把杂志收好，准备睡觉。

example.ex: All her letters were carefully filed away in folders...
example.tran: 她所有的信件都整齐地放在文件夹中。

entry.tran: 离（某人或某地）有一定距离
entry.def: If something is away from a person or place, it is at a distance from that person or place.

example.ex: The two women were sitting as far away from each other as possible...
example.tran: 那两个女人坐在离对方尽可能远的地方。

example.ex: I was anxious to get him here, away from family and friends.
example.tran: 我急于把他带到这儿，远离家人和朋友。

entry.def: You use away to talk about future events. For example, if an event is a week away, it will happen after a week.

example.ex: ...the Washington summit, now only just over two weeks away...
example.tran: 还有两周多时间即召开的华盛顿峰会

example.ex: Peace it seemed might at last be no more than a few months away.
example.tran: 看起来，几个月内也许会最终实现和平。

entry.def: When a sports team plays away, it plays on its opponents' ground.

example.ex: ...a sensational 4-3 victory for the team playing away.
example.tran: 该队在客场以4比3取得的引起轰动的胜利

entry.tran: （表示慢慢消失、变得不重要或慢慢改变）
entry.def: You can use away to say that something slowly disappears, becomes less significant, or changes so that it is no longer the same.

example.ex: So much snow has already melted away...
His voice died away in a whisper...
example.tran: 他的声音渐渐变为了小声低语。

entry.tran: （表示从一种状态到另一种状态的变化或发展）
entry.def: You use away to show that there has been a change or development from one state or situation to another.

example.ex: British courts are increasingly moving away from sending young offenders to prison...
example.tran: 英国法院渐渐地不再将少年犯送进监狱。

example.ex: There's been a dramatic shift away from traditional careers towards business and commerce.
example.tran: 从传统职业转向商贸领域的巨大转变已然发生了。

entry.def: You can use away to emphasize a continuous or repeated action.

example.ex: He would often be working away on his word processor late into the night...
example.tran: 他经常在文字处理机上一直工作到深夜。

example.ex: She sighed, her heart banging away against her ribs as she opened the door.
example.tran: 她叹了口气，开门时心一直在怦怦直跳。

entry.def: You use away to show that something is removed.

example.ex: If you take my work away I can't be happy anymore...
example.tran: 如果你炒我鱿鱼，我就再也高兴不起来了。

example.ex: The waitress whipped the plate away and put down my bill...
example.tran: 服务员把盘子撤走，放下了我的账单。

means.word_mean: 1. distant in either space or time;

sentences.sentence: "you must not allow a stranger into the house when your mother is away"

means.word_mean: 4. (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter;
1. from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete);

sentences.sentence: "sent the children away to boarding school"
"the teacher waved the children away from the dead animal"
"he gave out money to the poor"

means.word_mean: 3. out of the way (especially away from one's thoughts);

sentences.sentence: "tried to explain away the affair of the letter"- H.E.Scudder

means.word_mean: 5. at a distance in space or time;

sentences.sentence: "the party is still 2 weeks off (or away)"

means.word_mean: 6. indicating continuing action; continuously or steadily;

sentences.sentence: "he worked away at the project for more than a year"
"the child kept hammering away as if his life depended on it"

means.word_mean: 7. so as to be removed or gotten rid of;

sentences.sentence: "the rotted wood had to be cut away"

means.word_mean: 9. in or into a proper place (especially for storage or safekeeping);

sentences.sentence: "her jewels are locked away in a safe"

means.word_mean: 11. in reserve; not for immediate use;

sentences.sentence: "started setting aside money to buy a car"
"put something by for her old age"
"has a nestegg tucked away for a rainy day"

list.explanation: [下层社会用语]在狱中，蹲监狱

example.en: My cousin is away for a year.

list.explanation: 不经意地或慢呑吞地走出去，走开，逐渐离去

example.en: He spoke his piece and drifted away.
example.zh: 他发表了自已的意见，就悠然离开了。

list.explanation: 插科打诨，讲笑活，放噱头

example.en: I tove the way he threw away that misquotation.
example.zh: 我很欣赏他讲的笑话，引用那种张冠李戴的方法。

auth_sentence.content: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is it really time to throw the traditions away?

auth_sentence.content: What do you get up to away from football?
auth_sentence.res_content: What do you get up to away from football?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What do you get up to away from football?

auth_sentence.content: The shell should start to come away very easily.
auth_sentence.res_content: The shell should start to come away very easily.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The shell should start to come away very easily.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 加在单词前,表示"在……,……的"; 2. 注:加在描述性的动词前面表形容词,常用作表语;加在名词,形容词前构成副词.

stems_affixes.word_buile: a在……,……的+shore岸→adv.向岸地, 在岸上地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 在远处, 到远处, 离去
stems_affixes.word_buile: a在……,……的+way路→沿着路去了远方

Sentence.sentence: For now the app is also iPad-exclusive, and though a few of these educational institutions are giving the hardware away for free, for other students who don't have such a luxury it's an added layer of cost — and an expensive one at that.
Two months away in the capital?
There was a time when any personal information that was gathered about us was typed on a piece of paper and locked away in a file cabinet

Civilization,then,is fine — people banging away on their smartphones are fluently using a code separate from the one they use in actual writing, and there is no evidence that texting is ruining composition skills.
Singers use it to stay away from colds.
Consumers in developed countries throw away nearly half of their food purchases because they tend to buy in excessive quantities

sentences.en: He turned away and refused to listen.
sentences.cn: 他转过身去, 不愿再听了。

sentences.en: The boy hasn't been away from home before.
sentences.cn: 这男孩子以前还没离开过家。

sentences.en: The bridge is three miles away.

jushi.english: We lost two games in the away game.
jushi.chinese: 在那次客场赛中,我们输了两局。

jushi.english: The football team is playing away this weekend.
jushi.chinese: 本周末足球队将外出比赛。

jushi.english: He hurried away in the opposite direction.
jushi.chinese: 他朝相反方向匆匆走去。
